lead_paragraph: The Federal Aviation Administration says it has fixed many flaws made obvious by the crash of Continental Flight 3407, but others are not likely to be fixed for years, if at all.
snippet: The Federal Aviation Administration says it has fixed many flaws made obvious by the crash of Continental Flight 3407, but others are not likely to be fixed for years, if at all.

headline.main: Errors Cited in ’09 Crash Could Persist, F.A.A. Says
headline.seo: Flaws Seen in Buffalo Plane Crash Could Persist, F.A.A. Says
headline.print_headline: Errors Cited in ’09 Crash Could Persist, F.A.A. Says

byline.original: By MATTHEW L. WALD   and CHRISTINE NEGRONI
byline.contributor: Matthew L. Wald reported from Washington and Christine Negroni from Old Greenwich, Conn.
